title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: But what Tcad ye think ? In a fortnight or less — The deil tak his taste to gae near her ! He up the Gateslack to my black cousin Bess, Guess ye how, the jad ! I could bear her,

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: [" Gateslack," says Burns to Thomson, " is the name of a particular place, a kind of passage among the Low- ther Hills, on the confines of Dunifrieshire : Dalgarnock, is also the name of a romantic spot near the Nith, ■where are still a ruined church and burial-ground." To tliis, it may be added that Dalgarnock kirk-yard is the scene where the author of Waverley finds Old Mortality repairing  the Cameronian gravo-stones.]

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: [" Gateslack," says Burns to Thomson, " is the name of a particular place, a kind of passage among the Low- ther Hills, on the confines of Dumfrieshire : Dalgarnock, is also the name of a romantic spot near the Nith, where are still a ruined church and burial-ground." To this, it may be added that Dalgarnock kirk-yard is the scene where the author of Waverley finds Old Mortality repairing  the Cameronian grave-stones.]
